title: Designing High Availability Systems.pdf
description:
2013 | ISBN: 1118551125 | English | 480 pages | PDF | 27 MB

A practical, step-by-step guide to designing world-class, high availability systems using both classical and DFSS reliability techniques

Whether designing telecom, aerospace, automotive, medical, financial, or public safety systems, every engineer aims for the utmost reliability and availability in the systems he, or she, designs. 

But between the dream of world-class performance and reality falls the shadow of complexities that can bedevil even the most rigorous design process. 

While there are an array of robust predictive engineering tools, there has been no single-source guide to understanding and using them until now.
